summary: Email correspondence between DOJ/OIG and US Attorney's Office (SDNY) regarding scheduling interviews for the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The email discusses coordinating interviews with several individuals and requesting a copy of video evidence.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sends the initial email requesting coordination of interviews for the MCC investigation and is copied on the thread.

events.title: Coordination of MCC Death Investigation Interviews
events.description: Email correspondence to schedule interviews with several individuals as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is an email thread dated August 22, 2019, concerning the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the MCC.
It references a request for a copy of video evidence related to the investigation.
The email discusses scheduling interviews with at least five individuals for the following week, with two listed as 'low priority'.
The correspondence involves the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
All specific names of individuals to be interviewed and the email correspondents are redacted in the provided text.
